intro: Acetosella elatior, commonly known as the greater spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually prostrate or ascending. Acetosella elatior is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
